an3.68:4.1: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow other paths were to ask:
an3.68:4.8: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and refuge.
an3.68:4.9: Sir, may the Buddha himself please clarify the meaning of this.
an3.68:4.10: The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
an3.68:4.11: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an3.68:5.1: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow other paths were to ask:
an3.68:5.8: ‘Greed, reverends, is mildly blameworthy, but slow to fade away. Hate is very blameworthy, but quick to fade away. Delusion is very blameworthy, and slow to fade away.’
an3.68:6.1: And if they ask: ‘What is the cause, what is the reason why greed arises, and once arisen it increases and grows?’
an3.68:6.2: You should say: ‘The beautiful aspect of things.
an3.68:6.3: When you focus on the beautiful aspect of things in the wrong way, greed arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.
an3.68:6.4: This is the cause, this is the reason why greed arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.’
an3.68:7.1: And if they ask: ‘What is the cause, what is the reason why hate arises, and once arisen it increases and grows?’
an3.68:7.2: You should say: ‘The disagreeable aspect of things.
an3.68:7.3: When you focus on the disagreeable aspect of things in the wrong way, hate arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.
an3.68:7.4: This is the cause, this is the reason why hate arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.’
an3.68:8.1: And if they ask: ‘What is the cause, what is the reason why delusion arises, and once arisen it increases and grows?’
an3.68:8.2: You should say: ‘Focusing your mind in the wrong way.
an3.68:8.3: When you focus your mind in the wrong way, delusion arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.
an3.68:8.4: This is the cause, this is the reason why delusion arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.’
an3.68:9.1: And if they ask, ‘What is the cause, what is the reason why greed doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up?’
an3.68:9.2: You should say: ‘The ugly aspect of things.
an3.68:9.3: When you focus on the ugly aspect of things in the right way, greed doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up.
an3.68:9.4: This is the cause, this is the reason why greed doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up.’
an3.68:10.1: And if they ask, ‘What is the cause, what is the reason why hate doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up?’
an3.68:10.2: You should say: ‘The heart’s release by love.’
an3.68:10.3: When you focus properly on the heart’s release by love, hate doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up.
an3.68:10.4: This is the cause, this is the reason why hate doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up.’
an3.68:11.1: And if they ask, ‘What is the cause, what is the reason why delusion doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up?’
an3.68:11.2: You should say: ‘Focusing your mind in the right way.
an3.68:11.3: When you focus your mind in the right way, delusion doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up.
an3.68:11.4: This is the cause, this is the reason why delusion doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up.’”
